DESCRIPTION: When his attempt to save his family inadvertently alters the future, Barry Allen becomes trapped in a reality in which General Zod has returned and there are no Super Heroes to turn to.

Title: The Green Knight (2021)
GENRE: Drama, Fantasy, Epic Fantasy, Modern Fantasy, Action Adventure
DESCRIPTION: An epic fantasy adventure based on the timeless Arthurian legend, The Green Knight tells the story of Sir Gawain, King Arthur's reckless and headstrong nephew, who embarks on a daring quest to confront the eponymous Green Knight, a gigantic emerald-skinned stranger and tester of men.

Title: The Italian Job (2003)
GENRE: Action & Adventure, Crime, Mystery & Thriller, Heist
DESCRIPTION:
"The Italian Job," a stylish and action-packed 2003 heist thriller directed by F. Gary Gray, centers on Charlie Croker (Mark Wahlberg), a charismatic thief who assembles a team of skilled criminals for what should be the perfect gold heist in Venice, Italy. Their meticulously planned operation goes off without a hitch, but the one thing they didn't account for was being double-crossed by one of their own, the ruthless Steve Frears (Edward Norton), who leaves them for dead and makes off with their fortune.

Determined to exact revenge and reclaim their stolen loot, Charlie and his surviving crew, which includes the brilliant safecracker Stella Bridger (Charlize Theron), head to Los Angeles, where Steve is now living lavishly. What follows is a thrilling and intricate plan to outsmart Steve and pull off an audacious second heist right under his nose, utilizing a fleet of Mini Coopers for a pulse-pounding chase through the streets, tunnels, and even the subway system of LA. "The Italian Job" is a modern remake of the 1969 British classic, praised for its engaging characters, clever plot twists, and exhilarating car chases. It offers a fun and suspenseful ride with a blend of action, humor, and the satisfying execution of a well-crafted heist.

Title: The King's Speech (2010)
DESCRIPTION: The King's Speech tells the story of the man who became King George VI, the father of Queen Elizabeth II. After his brother abdicates, George ('Bertie') reluctantly assumes the throne. Plagued by a dreaded stutter and considered unfit to be king, Bertie engages the help of an unorthodox speech therapist named Lionel Logue. Through a set of unexpected techniques, and as a result of an unlikely friendship, Bertie is able to find his voice and boldly lead the country into war.

Title: The Little Things (2021)
DESCRIPTION: Deputy Sheriff Joe "Deke" Deacon joins forces with Sgt. Jim Baxter to search for a serial killer who's terrorizing Los Angeles. As they track the culprit, Baxter is unaware that the investigation is dredging up echoes of Deke's past, uncovering disturbing secrets that could threaten more than his case.

Title: The Machinist (2004)
DESCRIPTION: Trevor, an insomniac lathe operator, experiences unusual occurrences at work and home. A strange man follows him everywhere, but no one else seems to notice him.

Title: The Menu (2022)
DESCRIPTION: A couple travels to a coastal island to eat at an exclusive restaurant where the chef has prepared a lavish menu, with some shocking surprises.

Title: The Nice Guys (2016)
DESCRIPTION: A private eye investigates the apparent suicide of a fading porn star in 1970s Los Angeles and uncovers a conspiracy.

Title: The Proposal (2009)
GENRE: Drama, Comedy, Romance, RomCom, Chick Flicks
DESCRIPTION: When she learns she's in danger of losing her visa status and being deported, overbearing book editor Margaret Tate forces her put-upon assistant, Andrew Paxton, to marry her.

Title: The Shape of Water (2017)
DESCRIPTION: At a top secret research facility in the 1960s, a lonely janitor forms a unique relationship with an amphibious creature that is being held in captivity.

Title: The Silence of the Lambs (1991)
DESCRIPTION: Clarice Starling is a top student at the FBI's training academy. Jack Crawford wants Clarice to interview Dr. Hannibal Lecter, a brilliant psychiatrist who is also a violent psychopath, serving life behind bars for various acts of murder and cannibalism.

Title: The UnRedacted (2022)
DESCRIPTION: An unflinching look at government secrets and the journalists who work to expose them, featuring interviews with whistleblowers and examining the impact of classified information on democracy and national security.

Title: The Warriors (1979)
DESCRIPTION: Prominent gang leader Cyrus calls a meeting of New York's gangs to set aside their turf wars and take over the city. At the meeting, a rival leader kills Cyrus, but a Coney Island gang called the Warriors is wrongly blamed for Cyrus' death. Before you know it, the cops and every gangbanger in town is hot on the Warriors' trail.

Title: Thirteen Lives (2022)
GENRE: Mystery & Thriller, Drama, Based On A True Story
DESCRIPTION: Based on the true nail-biting mission that captivated the world. Twelve boys and the coach of a Thai soccer team explore the Tham Luang cave when an unexpected rainstorm traps them in a chamber inside the mountain. Entombed behind a maze of flooded cave tunnels, they face impossible odds. A team of world-class divers navigate through miles of dangerous cave networks to discover that finding the boys is only the beginning.

Title: Tony Allen: The Grindfather | Memphis Grizzlies Documentary (2025)
DESCRIPTION: This documentary chronicles Allen’s journey from his childhood in Chicago, to his collegiate career in Stillwater, Okla., to his time in Boston and finally his home in Memphis, showcasing the moments that defined the Grit & Grind era and shaped the Grizzlies and Allen himself.

Title: Trainspotting (1996)
DESCRIPTION: Mark Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

Title: TRON: Legacy (2010)
DESCRIPTION: Sam Flynn, the tech-savvy and daring son of Kevin Flynn, investigates his father's disappearance and is pulled into The Grid.

Title: Uncharted (2022)
DESCRIPTION: A young street-smart Nathan Drake and his wisecracking partner Victor Sully Sullivan embark on a dangerous pursuit of the greatest treasure never found while also tracking clues that may lead to Nathan's long-lost brother.

Title: Upgrade (2018)
DESCRIPTION: A brutal mugging leaves Grey Trace paralyzed in the hospital and his beloved wife dead. A billionaire inventor soon offers Trace a cure — an artificial intelligence implant called STEM that will enhance his body. Now able to walk, Grey finds that he also has superhuman strength and agility — skills he uses to seek revenge against the thugs who destroyed his life.

Title: Wicked City (1987)
GENRE: Horror, Animation, Action & Adventure, Fantasy, SyFy, Mystery & Thriller, Classic Japanese Anime
DESCRIPTION: A peace treaty between the Earth and the Black World, a parallel universe of demons, is coming to an end. Two cops, Taki, a human male, and Maki, a female demon, are assigned to protect a diplomat who will help secure another treaty. A radical group of demons from the Black World are out to assassinate the diplomat and prevent the treaty; only the bond that forms between the two cops can save the Earth from destruction.

Title: When We Were Kings (1996)
DESCRIPTION: It's 1974. Muhammad Ali is 32 and thought by many to be past his prime. George Foreman is ten years younger and the heavyweight champion of the world. Promoter Don King wants to make a name for himself and offers both fighters five million dollars apiece to fight one another, and when they accept, King has only to come up with the money. He finds a willing backer in Mobutu Sese Suko, the dictator of Zaire, and the 'Rumble in the Jungle' is set, including a musical festival featuring some of America's top black performers, like James Brown and B.B. King.

Title: Where to Invade Next (2015)
DESCRIPTION:
"Where to Invade Next," a thought-provoking and often humorous 2015 documentary directed by Michael Moore, sees the filmmaker embarking on a satirical journey across various countries to explore and invade them for their progressive social policies and ideas that could potentially benefit the United States. Instead of military might, Moore's invasion involves playfully planting the American flag and then delving into aspects of their society, from their education systems and labor laws to their healthcare and prison reforms.

Through his signature interviewing style, Moore examines how other nations address issues that are often contentious or problematic in America, offering a comparative look at different approaches to societal well-being. He visits countries like Italy for their generous vacation time, France for their school lunch programs, Finland for their education system, and Norway for their prison system, among others. "Where to Invade Next" aims to provoke thought and discussion about American values and systems by highlighting alternative models that exist elsewhere. While presented with Moore's characteristic blend of humor and pointed social commentary, the documentary offers a unique and engaging perspective on what the U.S. might learn from the rest of the world, sparking conversations about national priorities and the potential for positive change.

Title: Whiplash (2014)
DESCRIPTION: Under the direction of a ruthless instructor, a talented young drummer begins to pursue perfection at any cost, even his humanity.

Title: ZEF - The Story of Die Antwoord (2024)
DESCRIPTION:
"ZEF - The Story of Die Antwoord," a 2024 documentary directed and produced by JON DAY over five years, offers an in-depth look into the enigmatic and controversial South African rap-rave group Die Antwoord. Known for their unique 'Zef' counter-culture aesthetic and provocative music, the film delves into the origins, rise, and impact of Ninja and ¥o-landi Visser, the duo behind the group that took the global music scene by storm. The documentary features narration by their daughter, Sixteen Jones, providing a personal perspective on their unconventional journey.

With art direction by the renowned surrealist photographer Roger Ballen, the film promises a visually striking and unconventional exploration of Die Antwoord's artistic vision and the cultural context from which they emerged. It aims to unravel the mysteries surrounding their deliberately outrageous public persona and the complex dynamic between the artists and their art. "ZEF - The Story of Die Antwoord" offers fans and newcomers alike a chance to understand the forces that shaped this polarizing and influential musical phenomenon, providing insights into their creative process and the cultural movement they represent.

Title: Zootopia (2016)
DESCRIPTION: In a city of anthropomorphic animals, a rookie bunny cop and a cynical con artist fox must work together to uncover a conspiracy.

Title: Da 5 Bloods (2020)
DESCRIPTION: Four African-American Vietnam veterans return to Vietnam. They are in search of the remains of their fallen squad leader and the promise of buried treasure. These heroes battle forces of humanity and nature while confronted by the lasting ravages of the immorality of the Vietnam War.

Title: Hate to Love: Nickelback (2023)
DESCRIPTION: A documentary that explores the career of the band Nickelback, examining how they became one of the most commercially successful yet critically reviled bands in music history.

Title: Jurassic World Dominion (2022)
DESCRIPTION: Four years after the destruction of Isla Nublar, dinosaurs now live and hunt alongside humans all over the world. This fragile balance will reshape the future and determine, once and for all, whether human beings are to remain the apex predators on a planet they now share with history's most fearsome creatures.

Title: Kelce (2023)
DESCRIPTION: An intimate documentary that follows Philadelphia Eagles center Jason Kelce during what might be his final year in the NFL, exploring his journey, career highlights, and the personal struggles of an athlete contemplating retirement.

Title: Kill Boksoon (2023)
DESCRIPTION: At work, she's a renowned assassin. At home, she's a single mom to a teenage daughter. Killing? That's easy. It's parenting that's the hard part.

Title: Kingpin (1996)
DESCRIPTION: A star bowler whose career was prematurely cut short returns to the lanes years later hoping to coach a promising young player and get his life back on track in the process.

Title: Licorice Pizza (2021)
DESCRIPTION: The story of Alana Kane and Gary Valentine growing up, running around and going through the treacherous navigation of first love in the San Fernando Valley, 1973.

Title: Little Fish (2020)
DESCRIPTION: A couple fights to hold their relationship together as a memory loss virus spreads and threatens to erase the history of their love and courtship.

Title: Looper (2012)
DESCRIPTION: In 2074, when the mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent into the past, where a hired gun awaits - someone like Joe - who one day learns the mob wants to 'close the loop' by sending back Joe's future self for assassination.

Title: Malevolent (2018)
DESCRIPTION: A team of scam artists get more than they bargained for when a job at a haunted country estate goes terribly wrong.

Title: Man on Wire (2008)
DESCRIPTION: A look at tightrope walker Philippe Petit's daring, but illegal, high-wire routine performed between New York City's World Trade Center's twin towers in 1974, what some consider "the artistic crime of the century".

Title: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On (2021)
DESCRIPTION:
"Marcel the Shell with Shoes On," a charming and heartwarming 2021 animated film directed by Dean Fleischer-Camp, brings to life the endearing character of Marcel, a one-inch-tall seashell who navigates the world with tiny shoes. Marcel resides in a house filled with personality alongside his beloved grandmother Connie and their loyal pet lint, Alan. Once part of a thriving community of shells, they now find themselves as the sole survivors of an unexplained departure of their fellow shell citizens.

Their quiet existence is unexpectedly disrupted when a documentary filmmaker, Dean, rents their home and begins to capture Marcel's unique perspective on life. The short film he uploads online unexpectedly catapults Marcel to viral fame, bringing him millions of enthusiastic fans and, along with the adoration, unforeseen challenges and a glimmer of hope in his quest to find his long-lost family. Based on a series of popular online shorts, the feature film expands Marcel's world with gentle humor, poignant moments, and a profound exploration of connection, loss, and the resilience of community. Praised for its innovative blend of stop-motion animation and live-action, and Jenny Slate's delightful voice performance as Marcel, the film resonated with audiences for its sincerity and its unique perspective on the everyday wonders of the world.

Title: Miller's Crossing (1990)
DESCRIPTION: Tom Regan, an advisor to a Prohibition-era crime boss, tries to keep the peace between warring mobs but gets caught in divided loyalties.

Title: Monster Hunter (2020)
DESCRIPTION: When an unexpected sandstorm transports Captain Artemis and her unit to a new world, the soldiers are shocked to discover that this hostile and unknown environment is home to enormous and terrifying monsters immune to their firepower.

Title: Morris from America (2016)
DESCRIPTION: The romantic and coming-of-age misadventures of a 13-year-old American living in Germany.

Title: My Octopus Teacher (2020)
DESCRIPTION: After years of swimming every day in the freezing ocean at the tip of Africa, Craig Foster meets an unlikely teacher: a young octopus who displays remarkable curiosity. Visiting her den and tracking her movements for months on end he eventually wins the animal's trust and they develop a never-before-seen bond between human and wild animal.

Title: Needle in a Timestack (2021)
DESCRIPTION: A devoted husband will stop at nothing to save his marriage when it's destroyed by a time-traveling rival.

Title: Oldboy (2003)
DESCRIPTION: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.

Title: Only the Strong (1993)
DESCRIPTION: A former Special Forces soldier becomes a high school teacher and uses the Brazilian martial art of capoeira to inspire and discipline troubled students.

Title: Oppenheimer (2023)
DESCRIPTION: The story of American scientist J. Robert Oppenheimer and his role in the development of the atomic bomb.

Title: Paris Can Wait (2016)
DESCRIPTION: The wife of a successful movie producer takes a car trip from the south of France to Paris with one of her husband's associates.

Title: Plus One (2019)
DESCRIPTION: In order to survive a summer of wedding fever, longtime single friends, Ben and Alice, agree to be each other's plus one at every wedding they've been invited to.

Title: Polite Society (2023)
DESCRIPTION: Martial artist-in-training Ria Khan believes she must save her older sister Lena from her impending marriage. After enlisting the help of her friends, Ria attempts to pull off the most ambitious of all wedding heists in the name of independence and sisterhood.

Title: Racing with the Moon (1984)
DESCRIPTION: In 1942, as America prepares to enter World War II, two young men, friends since childhood, fall in love with the same woman and find their friendship tested.

Title: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver (2024)
DESCRIPTION: The rebel warriors prepare for battle against the Motherworld. As they train, they must face the truths of their own pasts, each revealing why they fight.

Title: Red Planet (2000)
DESCRIPTION: Astronauts, and their robotic dog AMEE, search for solutions to save a dying Earth by searching on Mars, only to have the mission go terribly awry.

Title: Rubber (2010)
DESCRIPTION: A homicidal car tire, discovering it has destructive psionic power, sets its sights on a desert town once a mysterious woman becomes its obsession.

Title: Rust and Bone (2012)
DESCRIPTION: Put in charge of his young son, Alain leaves Belgium for Antibes to live with his sister and her husband as a family. Alain's bond with Stephanie, a killer whale trainer, grows deeper after Stephanie suffers a horrible accident.

Title: Shaft (2000)
DESCRIPTION: New York police detective John Shaft arrests Walter Wade Jr. for a racially motivated slaying. But the only eyewitness disappears, and Wade jumps bail for Switzerland. Two years later Wade returns to face trial, confident his money and influence will get him acquitted -- especially since he's paid a drug kingpin to kill the witness.

Title: She's All That (1999)
DESCRIPTION: A high school jock makes a bet that he can turn an unattractive girl into the school's prom queen.

Title: Shirkers (2018)
DESCRIPTION: In 1992, teenager Sandi Tan and her friends Sophie and Jasmine shot Singapore's first indie film with their enigmatic American mentor, Georges. After shooting wrapped, Georges vanished with all the footage. 20 years later, the 16mm cans are recovered in New Orleans, sending Sandi on a personal odyssey in search of Georges' vanishing footprints.

Title: Short Term 12 (2013)
DESCRIPTION: A 20-something supervising staff member of a residential treatment facility navigates the troubled waters of that world alongside her co-worker and longtime boyfriend.

Title: Shutter Island (2010)
DESCRIPTION: World War II soldier-turned-U.S. Marshal Teddy Daniels investigates the disappearance of a patient from a hospital for the criminally insane, but his efforts are compromised by his troubling visions and also by a mysterious doctor.

Title: Sixteen Candles (1984)
DESCRIPTION: A girl's "sweet" sixteenth birthday becomes anything but special, as she suffers from every embarrassment possible.

Title: Sonic the Hedgehog (2020)
DESCRIPTION: After discovering a small, blue, fast hedgehog, a small-town police officer must help it defeat an evil genius who wants to do experiments on it.

Title: Source Code (2011)
DESCRIPTION: A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.

Title: Spaceman (2024)
DESCRIPTION: An astronaut sent to the edge of the galaxy to collect mysterious ancient dust finds his earthly life falling to pieces. He turns to the only voice who can help him try to put it back together. It just so happens to belong to a creature from the beginning of time lurking in the shadows of his ship.

Title: Spartan (2004)
DESCRIPTION: U.S. government agent Scott is assigned to rescue the daughter of a high-ranking government official. As willing as he is to bend the rules to get things done, though, Scott is shocked to find that others are willing to go even further to protect a political career.

Title: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (2023)
DESCRIPTION: After reuniting with Gwen Stacy, Brooklyn's full-time, friendly neighborhood Spider-Man is catapulted across the Multiverse, where he encounters the Spider Society, a team of Spider-People charged with protecting the Multiverse's very existence. But when the heroes clash on how to handle a new threat, Miles finds himself pitted against the other Spiders and must set out on his own to save those he loves most.

Title: Spider-Man: No Way Home (2021)
DESCRIPTION: Peter Parker is unmasked and no longer able to separate his normal life from the high-stakes of being a superhero. When he asks for help from Doctor Strange the stakes become even more dangerous, forcing him to discover what it truly means to be Spider-Man.

Title: Starship Troopers (1997)
GENRE: SyFy, Action & Adventure, War & Military, Satire
DESCRIPTION: Set in the future, the story follows a young soldier named Johnny Rico and his exploits in the Mobile Infantry. Rico's military career progresses from recruit to non-commissioned officer and finally to officer against the backdrop of an interstellar war between mankind and an arachnoid species known as "the Bugs".

Title: Strange Days (1995)
GENRE: SyFy, Mystery & Thriller, Crime, Drama, Tech Noir
DESCRIPTION: Lenny Nero, a former cop, sells virtual reality-like recordings that allow users to experience the emotions and past experiences of others. While the bootlegs typically contain harmless memories, Nero receives one showing a murder, and decides to investigate.

Title: Strays (2023)
DESCRIPTION: When Reggie is abandoned on the mean city streets by his lowlife owner, Doug, Reggie is certain that his beloved owner would never leave him on purpose. But once Reggie falls in with a fast-talking, foul-mouthed stray who loves his freedom and believes that owners are for suckers, Reggie finally realizes he was in a toxic relationship and begins to see Doug for the heartless sleazeball that he is.

Title: Stutz (2022)
DESCRIPTION: In candid conversations with actor Jonah Hill, leading psychiatrist Phil Stutz explores his early life experiences and unique, visual model of therapy.

Title: Suicide Squad (2016)
DESCRIPTION: From DC Comics comes the Suicide Squad, an antihero team of incarcerated supervillains who act as deniable assets for the United States government, undertaking high-risk black ops missions in exchange for commuted prison sentences.

Title: Sunset Park (1996)
DESCRIPTION: A high school teacher becomes the coach of the underachieving boys basketball team at Sunset Park High School in Brooklyn, New York.

Title: The Big Lebowski (1998)
DESCRIPTION: Jeffrey "The Dude" Lebowski, a Los Angeles slacker who only wants to bowl and drink white Russians, is mistaken for another Jeffrey Lebowski, a wheelchair-bound millionaire, and finds himself dragged into a strange series of events involving nihilists, adult film producers, ferrets, errant toes, and large sums of money.

Title: The Book of Clarence (2024)
DESCRIPTION: Streetwise but struggling, Clarence is captivated by the power and glory of the rising Messiah and His apostles. In a misguided effort to help his family out of a desperate situation, he embarks on a misadventure to become one of them.

Title: The Cable Guy (1996)
DESCRIPTION:
"The Cable Guy," a 1996 dark comedy thriller directed by Ben Stiller, stars Matthew Broderick as Steven M. Kovak, a recently single architect who moves into a new apartment. In an attempt to expedite his cable installation, Steven bribes the eccentric cable technician, Chip Douglas, portrayed with intense and unsettling energy by Jim Carrey. Initially appearing as an overly eager and quirky individual desperate for a friend, Chip quickly becomes an intrusive and possessive presence in Steven's life.

As Chip's attempts at friendship become increasingly bizarre and disruptive, Steven tries to distance himself, only to unleash Chip's darker and more manipulative side. What begins as an awkward acquaintance spirals into a nightmarish ordeal of stalking, sabotage, and psychological torment. "The Cable Guy" offers a unique blend of comedic absurdity and genuine suspense, exploring themes of loneliness, obsession, and the blurred lines between connection and intrusion in an increasingly media-saturated world. While the film divided critics upon its release for its tonal shifts, Carrey's performance is often cited as a bold and memorable departure from his more overtly comedic roles, and the film has since garnered a cult following for its unsettling and darkly humorous portrayal of unwanted friendship turned menacing.

Title: Darkest Hour (2017)
DESCRIPTION: A thrilling and inspiring true story begins on the eve of World War II as, within days of becoming prime Minister of Great Britain, Winston Churchill must face one of his most turbulent and defining trials: exploring a negotiated peace treaty with Nazi Germany, or standing firm to fight for the ideals, liberty and freedom of a nation.

Title: The Fault in Our Stars (2014)
DESCRIPTION: Despite the tumor-shrinking medical miracle that has bought her a few years, Hazel has never been anything but terminal, her final chapter inscribed upon diagnosis. But when a patient named Augustus Waters suddenly appears at Cancer Kid Support Group, Hazel's story is about to be completely rewritten.

Title: The Godfather (1972)
DESCRIPTION: Spanning the years 1945 to 1955, a chronicle of the fictional Italian-American Corleone crime family. When organized crime family patriarch, Vito Corleone barely survives an attempt on his life, his youngest son, Michael steps in to take care of the would-be killers, launching a campaign of bloody revenge.

Title: The Godfather: Part II (1974)
DESCRIPTION: In the continuing saga of the Corleone crime family, a young Vito Corleone grows up in Sicily and in 1910s New York. In the 1950s, Michael Corleone attempts to expand the family business into Las Vegas, Hollywood and Cuba.

Title: The Godfather: Part III (1990)
DESCRIPTION: In the midst of trying to legitimize his business dealings in 1979 New York and Italy, aging mafia don, Michael Corleone seeks forgiveness for his sins while taking a young protege under his wing.

Title: The Greatest Night in Pop (2024)
DESCRIPTION: On January 25th, 1985, the biggest artists in music came together to record "We Are the World." This documentary explores how this historic event came to be.

Title: The Incredible Hulk (2008)
DESCRIPTION: Scientist Bruce Banner scours the planet for an antidote to the unbridled force of rage within him: the Hulk. But when the military masterminds who dream of exploiting his powers force him back to civilization, he finds himself coming face to face with a new, deadly foe.

Title: The Last Duel (2021)
DESCRIPTION: King Charles VI declares that Knight Jean de Carrouges settle his dispute with his squire, Jacques Le Gris, by challenging him to a duel.

Title: The Last Repair Shop (2023)
DESCRIPTION: Deep inside a century-old building in downtown Los Angeles, four master craftspeople restore and repair musical instruments for the thousands of students in the city's public school district, keeping the largest music program in the country alive.

Title: The Lovebirds (2020)
DESCRIPTION: A couple experiences a defining moment in their relationship when they are unintentionally embroiled in a murder mystery. As their journey to clear their names takes them from one extreme – and hilarious - circumstance to the next, they must figure out how they, and their relationship, can survive the night.

Title: The Lunchbox (2013)
DESCRIPTION: A mistaken delivery in Mumbai's famously efficient lunchbox delivery system (Mumbai's Dabbawallahs) connects a young housewife to a stranger in the dusk of his life. They build a fantasy world together through notes in the lunchbox. Gradually, this fantasy threatens to overwhelm their reality.

Title: The Men Who Stare at Goats (2009)
DESCRIPTION: A journalist in Iraq might have an incredible story when he meets a Special Forces soldier who tells him that the army is training people to kill goats with their minds.

Title: The Mist (2007)
DESCRIPTION: After a violent storm, a dense cloud of mist envelops a small Maine town, trapping artist David Drayton and his five-year-old son in a local grocery store with other people. They soon discover that the mist conceals deadly horrors that threaten their lives, and worse, their sanity.

Title: The Redeem Team (2022)
DESCRIPTION: Using unprecedented Olympic footage and behind-the-scenes material, The Redeem Team tells the story of the US Olympic Men's Basketball Team's quest for gold at the 2008 Olympic Games in Beijing following the previous team's shocking performance four years earlier in Athens.

Title: The Source Family (2012)
DESCRIPTION: The Source Family was a radical experiment in '70s utopian living. Their outlandish lifestyle, revolutionary music, and sustainable commune outgrowth of the hippie movement created a fascinating legacy that is still reverberating today.

Title: The Suicide Squad (2021)
DESCRIPTION: Supervillains Harley Quinn, Bloodsport, Peacemaker and a collection of nutty cons at Belle Reve prison join the super-secret, super-shady Task Force X as they are dropped off at the remote, enemy-infused island of Corto Maltese.

Title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie (2023)
DESCRIPTION: While working underground to fix a water main, Brooklyn plumbers—and brothers—Mario and Luigi are transported down a mysterious pipe and wander into a magical new world. But when the brothers are separated, Mario embarks on an epic quest to find Luigi.

Title: The Woman King (2022)
DESCRIPTION: The story of the Agojie, the all-female unit of warriors who protected the African Kingdom of Dahomey in the 1800s with skills and a fierceness unlike anything the world has ever seen, and General Nanisca as she trains the next generation of recruits and readies them for battle against an enemy determined to destroy their way of life.

Title: The Wonderful Story of Henry Sugar (2023)
DESCRIPTION: A collection of short stories by acclaimed children's author Roald Dahl, centered on the titular story about a rich man who learns about a guru who can see without using his eyes and then sets out to master the skill in order to cheat at gambling.

Title: They Cloned Tyrone (2023)
DESCRIPTION: A series of eerie events thrusts an unlikely trio onto the trail of a nefarious government conspiracy in this pulpy mystery caper.

Title: Thor (2011)
DESCRIPTION: Against his father Odin's will, The Mighty Thor - a powerful but arrogant warrior god - recklessly reignites an ancient war. Thor is cast down to Earth and forced to live among humans as punishment. Once here, Thor learns what it takes to be a true hero when the most dangerous villain of his world sends the darkest forces of Asgard to invade Earth.

Title: Thor: Love and Thunder (2022)
DESCRIPTION: After his retirement is interrupted by Gorr the God Butcher, a galactic killer who seeks the extinction of the gods, Thor enlists the help of King Valkyrie, Korg, and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster, who now inexplicably wields Mjolnir as the Mighty Thor. Together they embark upon a harrowing cosmic adventure to uncover the mystery of the God Butcher's vengeance and stop him before it's too late.

Title: Thor: Ragnarok (2017)
DESCRIPTION: Thor is imprisoned on the other side of the universe and finds himself in a race against time to get back to Asgard to stop Ragnarok, the destruction of his home-world and the end of Asgardian civilization, at the hands of a powerful new threat, the ruthless Hela.

Title: Thor: The Dark World (2013)
DESCRIPTION: Thor fights to restore order across the cosmos… but an ancient race led by the vengeful Malekith returns to plunge the universe back into darkness. Faced with an enemy that even Odin and Asgard cannot withstand, Thor must embark on his most perilous and personal journey yet, one that will reunite him with Jane Foster and force him to sacrifice everything to save us all.

Title: Three Thousand Years of Longing (2022)
DESCRIPTION: A solitary scholar discovers an ancient bottle while on a trip to Istanbul and unleashes a djinn who offers her three wishes. Filled with reluctance, she is unable to come up with one, so the djinn tries to inspire her with his stories.

Title: Tolkien (2019)
DESCRIPTION: England, early 20th century. The future writer and philologist John Ronald Reuel Tolkien (1892-1973) and three of his schoolmates create a strong bond between them as they share the same passion for literature and art, a true fellowship that strengthens as they grow up, but the outbreak of World War I threatens to shatter it.

Title: Transcendence (2014)
DESCRIPTION:
"Transcendence," a 2014 science fiction thriller marking the directorial debut of cinematographer Wally Pfister, delves into the complex and potentially perilous realm of artificial intelligence and technological singularity. The film centers on Dr. Will Caster (Johnny Depp), a brilliant but controversial researcher at the forefront of AI development, striving to create a sentient machine that surpasses human cognitive capabilities. Alongside his wife Evelyn (Rebecca Hall), a fellow scientist, Will pushes the boundaries of his work towards achieving what they call 'Transcendence' – the uploading of human consciousness into a computer.

Their groundbreaking research attracts the attention of a radical anti-technology organization, led by Wade Streiber (Paul Bettany), who fear the potential dangers of such powerful AI. Following a violent attack, Will's consciousness is indeed uploaded into their experimental system, leading to unforeseen and rapidly evolving consequences. As Will's digital presence grows exponentially, Evelyn and their colleagues grapple with the implications of his newfound abilities and the potential threat it poses to humanity. "Transcendence" explores timely and thought-provoking questions about the future of technology, the nature of consciousness, and the potential for AI to both elevate and endanger human existence. While the film received mixed reviews, it sparked discussions about the ethical and existential dilemmas inherent in the pursuit of advanced artificial intelligence.

Title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon (2011)
DESCRIPTION: Sam Witwicky takes his first tenuous steps into adulthood while remaining a reluctant human ally of Autobot-leader Optimus prime. The film centers around the space race between the USSR and the USA, suggesting there was a hidden Transformers role in it all that remains one of the planet's most dangerous secrets.

Title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009)
DESCRIPTION: Sam Witwicky leaves the Autobots behind for a normal life. But when his mind is filled with cryptic symbols, the Decepticons target him and he is dragged back into the Transformers' war.

Title: Tron (1982)
DESCRIPTION: As Kevin Flynn searches for proof that he invented a hit video game, he is 'digitalized' by a laser and finds himself inside The Grid, where programs suffer under the tyrannical rule of the Master Control Program.

Title: Us (2019)
DESCRIPTION: Husband and wife Gabe and Adelaide Wilson take their kids to their beach house expecting to unplug and unwind with friends. But as night descends, their serenity turns to tension and chaos when some shocking visitors arrive uninvited.

Title: Vanilla Sky (2001)
DESCRIPTION: David Aames has it all: wealth, good looks and gorgeous women on his arm. But just as he begins falling for the warmhearted Sofia, his face is horribly disfigured in a car accident. That's just the beginning of his troubles as the lines between illusion and reality, between life and death, are blurred.

Title: Venom (2018)
DESCRIPTION: Investigative journalist Eddie Brock attempts a comeback following a scandal, but accidentally becomes the host of Venom, a violent, super powerful alien symbiote. Soon, he must rely on his newfound powers to protect the world from a shadowy organization looking for a symbiote of their own.

Title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage (2021)
DESCRIPTION: After finding a host body in investigative reporter Eddie Brock, the alien symbiote must face a new enemy, Carnage, the alter ego of serial killer Cletus Kasady.

Title: Virus (1999)
DESCRIPTION:
"Virus," a 1999 science fiction horror film directed by John Bruno, unfolds in the vast and unforgiving Bering Strait. When the crew of an American tugboat, led by Captain Robert Everton (Donald Sutherland), encounters a seemingly abandoned Russian research vessel caught in a violent storm, they decide to board it in hopes of salvage. However, they soon discover that the ship is far from deserted and harbors a malevolent extraterrestrial life form.

This alien entity, an intelligent and highly adaptable organism that arrived on Earth via a damaged satellite, views humanity as a biological virus that must be eradicated. It has begun to assimilate the Russian crew, transforming them into grotesque cyborg creatures. As the American crew explores the derelict ship, they find themselves hunted by these terrifying beings, leading to a desperate fight for survival against an enemy that is both relentless and technologically superior. "Virus" delivers a chilling tale of extraterrestrial invasion and body horror, set in a confined and isolated environment. While the film received largely negative reviews upon its release, it has garnered a following for its creature design and its straightforward, suspenseful approach to the sci-fi horror genre.

Title: We Live in Time (2024)
DESCRIPTION: The story of Almut and Tobias's love is told in a non-chronological but very emotional way, from their chance meeting to what follows in the decades after.

Title: When Harry Met Sally (1989)
DESCRIPTION: During their travel from Chicago to New York, Harry and Sally debate whether or not sex ruins a friendship between a man and a woman. Eleven years later, and they're still no closer to finding the answer.

Title: White Men Can't Jump (1992)
DESCRIPTION: Billy Hoyle and Sidney Deane are an unlikely pair of basketball hustlers. They team up to con their way across the courts of Los Angeles, playing a game that's fast dangerous - and funny.

Title: Who Shot the Sheriff (2018)
DESCRIPTION: In 1976, reggae icon Bob Marley survived an assassination attempt as political violence swept Jamaica. But who exactly was responsible?

Title: Wing Commander (1999)
DESCRIPTION: The Hollywood version of the popular video game series "Wing Commander". Unlike other video games to feature film transitions, series creator Chris Roberts was heavily involved in the film's creation. This is the story of Christopher Blair and Todd Marshall as they enter the ranks of the Terran Confederation Space Force and fight the war against the Kilrathi.

Title: You People (2023)
DESCRIPTION: Ezra Cohen and Amira Mohammed are a lovestruck couple getting ready for marriage. Before they can tie the knot, the pair must meet each other’s families. Between cultural differences, generational divides, and familial expectations, Ezra and Amira have to survive a thorough and deep investigation from both of their families. It is said that no matter what that love will endure and both the Cohens and the Mohammeds are putting that to the test.

Title: Gattaca (1997)
DESCRIPTION: In a future society in the era of indefinite eugenics, humans are set on a life course depending on their DNA. Young Vincent Freeman is born with a condition that would prevent him from space travel, yet is determined to infiltrate the GATTACA space program.

Title: Save Yourselves! (2020)
DESCRIPTION: A young Brooklyn couple head upstate to disconnect from their phones and reconnect with themselves. Cut off from their devices, they miss the news that the planet is under attack.

Title: Tenet (2020)
DESCRIPTION: Armed with only one word - Tenet - and fighting for the survival of the entire world, the Protagonist journeys through a twilight world of international espionage on a mission that will unfold in something beyond real time.

Title: Jurassic World (2015)
DESCRIPTION: Twenty-two years after the events of Jurassic Park, Isla Nublar now features a fully functioning dinosaur theme park, Jurassic World, as originally envisioned by John Hammond.

Title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)
DESCRIPTION: Three years after the demise of Jurassic World, a volcanic eruption threatens the remaining dinosaurs on the isla Nublar, so Claire Dearing, the former park manager, recruits Owen Grady to help prevent the extinction of the dinosaurs once again.

Title: The New Mutants (2020)
DESCRIPTION: Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.

Title: Logan (2017)
DESCRIPTION:
Logan, released in 2017, offers a gritty and emotionally resonant take on the superhero genre, a far cry from the typical caped crusader fare. Directed by James Mangold, who also co-wrote the screenplay, this film presents a near-future where mutants are on the brink of extinction. Hugh Jackman returns as the iconic Wolverine, now going by Logan, a weary and aged figure whose healing factor is fading. He cares for an ailing and mentally unstable Professor Charles Xavier, portrayed once again by Patrick Stewart, in a secluded outpost near the Mexican border.

Logan's desire for solitude is shattered when he encounters Laura, a young mutant girl played by Dafne Keen in her debut film role, who possesses abilities strikingly similar to his own. Pursued by relentless forces connected to a sinister corporation, Logan reluctantly takes on the role of protector, embarking on a violent and poignant road trip. The film, taking inspiration from the "Old Man Logan" comic book storyline, delves into themes of mortality, legacy, and the search for meaning in a world that has moved on.

"Logan" was designed to feel more like a Western than a traditional superhero movie, with a dark and visceral tone that earned it an R rating – a first for the Wolverine cinematic outings. The cast also includes Boyd Holbrook as the menacing Donald Pierce and Richard E. Grant as the calculating Dr. Rice. Upon its release, "Logan" was met with widespread critical acclaim, lauded for its raw action, profound emotional depth, the powerful performances of Jackman and Keen, and Mangold's direction. It is often considered one of the best films in the X-Men franchise and even garnered an Academy Award nomination for Best Adapted Screenplay, a rare feat for a live-action superhero movie. The film became a significant commercial success, grossing over $619 million worldwide, and was the third-highest-grossing R-rated film at the time of its release. Notably, Jackman and Keen reprised their roles in the 2024 film Deadpool & Wolverine.

Title: Tombstone (1993)
DESCRIPTION: Legendary marshal Wyatt Earp, now a weary gunfighter, joins his brothers Morgan and Virgil to pursue their collective fortune in the thriving mining town of Tombstone. But Earp is forced to don a badge again and get help from his friend Doc Holliday when a gang of renegade brigands and rustlers begins terrorizing the town.

Title: Fried Green Tomatoes (1991)
DESCRIPTION: Unhappy housewife Evelyn Couch meets Ninny Threadgoode, an elderly woman who tells her the story of Idgie Threadgoode, a young woman in 1920s Alabama. Through Idgie's inspiring life, Evelyn learns to be more assertive and builds a lasting friendship of her own with Ninny.

Title: Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn) (2020)
DESCRIPTION:
"Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn)," a vibrant and action-packed 2020 film directed by Cathy Yan, follows the chaotic adventures of Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie) after her tumultuous breakup with the Joker. Free from his shadow, Harley navigates the criminal underworld of Gotham City with her signature unpredictable style. When a young girl named Cassandra Cain (Ella Jay Basco) comes into possession of a highly coveted diamond belonging to the ruthless crime lord Roman Sionis, also known as Black Mask (Ewan McGregor), Harley finds herself unexpectedly drawn into the conflict.

As Black Mask and his menacing right-hand man Victor Zsasz (Chris Messina) hunt for Cassandra, Harley's path intersects with a diverse group of formidable women: Dinah Lance, a singer with a powerful voice and a secret past (Jurnee Smollett); Helena Bertinelli, a crossbow-wielding vigilante known as the Huntress (Mary Elizabeth Winstead); and Renee Montoya, a determined Gotham City detective (Rosie Perez). This unlikely alliance forms as they band together to protect Cassandra and take down Black Mask. "Birds of Prey" delivers a visually dynamic and fiercely independent story with a distinct female perspective, filled with stylish action sequences, dark humor, and Harley Quinn's signature anarchic energy. While connected to the DC Extended Universe, it carves its own path with a fresh and exhilarating take on the superhero genre.

Title: Underwater (2020)
DESCRIPTION:
"Underwater," a tense and claustrophobic 2020 science fiction horror film directed by William Eubank, plunges viewers into the crushing depths of the ocean. Following a catastrophic earthquake that devastates their deep-sea research and drilling facility located seven miles beneath the surface, a small group of survivors must band together to find a way to safety. Led by the resourceful Norah Price (Kristen Stewart), the six researchers face a perilous two-mile trek across the treacherous and unknown ocean floor to reach the main section of the station.

As they navigate the darkness and the immense pressure, they soon realize that the earthquake has awakened something ancient and deadly lurking in the abyss. They are not alone in the deep, and their desperate race against time to survive is compounded by the terrifying creatures that begin to hunt them. "Underwater" delivers a suspenseful and atmospheric experience, combining elements of disaster films with creature feature horror. Praised for its intense pacing and claustrophobic setting, the film traps the audience alongside the characters in a fight for survival against both the environment and the terrifying unknown that dwells in the deepest parts of the ocean.

Title: Dark Phoenix (2019)
DESCRIPTION:
"Dark Phoenix," the 2019 installment in the X-Men saga, directed by Simon Kinberg, revisits one of the most iconic and powerful storylines in the X-Men comics. During a perilous rescue mission in the vast expanse of outer space, Jean Grey (Sophie Turner), a gifted mutant with telepathic and telekinetic abilities, is struck by a mysterious and immensely powerful cosmic force. Upon their return to Earth, this cosmic energy begins to manifest in Jean, amplifying her powers to unprecedented levels, but also making them dangerously unstable and difficult to control.

As Jean grapples with her newfound abilities, which threaten to overwhelm her, a sinister alien race, the Shi'ar, takes notice of her immense power and seeks to exploit it for their own galactic ambitions. The X-Men, including Professor Charles Xavier (James McAvoy), Magneto (Michael Fassbender), and others, must band together to save Jean from herself and from the extraterrestrial forces that would manipulate her. "Dark Phoenix" explores themes of power, corruption, and the struggle for control, as the fate of Jean Grey and potentially the entire galaxy hangs in the balance. While the film aimed to deliver a definitive cinematic adaptation of the classic Dark Phoenix saga, it faced mixed reviews upon its release.

Title: Assassin's Creed (2016)
DESCRIPTION:
"Assassin's Creed," a 2016 action-fantasy film directed by Justin Kurzel, brings to the big screen the popular video game franchise of the same name. The story centers on Callum Lynch (Michael Fassbender), a modern-day man who is forcibly taken by the Abstergo Foundation, a front for the modern-day Templars. Through a revolutionary technology called the Animus, Callum is able to access his genetic memories and relive the experiences of his ancestor, Aguilar de Nerha, a skilled Assassin living in 15th-century Spain during the Spanish Inquisition.

As Callum immerses himself in Aguilar's past, he not only witnesses the historical conflict between the Assassins and the Templars but also gains the knowledge and fighting skills of his ancestor. The Templars, in the present day, are searching for an ancient artifact known as the Apple of Eden, and they believe Callum's ancestral memories hold the key to its location. "Assassin's Creed" blends historical settings with futuristic technology and high-octane action sequences, showcasing the acrobatic and combat prowess of the Assassins. While opinions on its adaptation of the game's intricate lore were divided, the film offers a visually rich and action-packed narrative that explores themes of free will versus control and the enduring battle between two secret societies across centuries.

Title: The Creator (2023)
DESCRIPTION:
"The Creator," a 2023 science fiction action-drama directed by Gareth Edwards, unfolds in a future scarred by a devastating war between humanity and highly advanced artificial intelligence. At the heart of this conflict is Joshua (John David Washington), a hardened former special forces agent haunted by the disappearance of his wife. He is reluctantly recruited by the military for a critical and dangerous mission: to locate and eliminate the enigmatic architect of advanced AI, known only as the Creator.

The Creator has developed a mysterious weapon that possesses the potential to bring an end to the war, and perhaps to mankind itself. As Joshua ventures deep into enemy territory, he begins to uncover the complex realities of the AI and the humans caught in the crossfire, forcing him to question his mission and the true nature of the conflict. "The Creator" blends intense action sequences with thought-provoking themes about the nature of consciousness, artificial intelligence, and the future of humanity. The film garnered attention for its stunning visual effects and its exploration of timely and relevant questions about the relationship between humans and AI in a world teetering on the brink of annihilation.

Title: Romeo + Juliet (1996)
DESCRIPTION:
"Romeo + Juliet," director Baz Luhrmann's vibrant and stylized 1996 adaptation of William Shakespeare's timeless tragedy, transports the classic tale of star-crossed lovers to the modern, sun-drenched setting of Verona Beach. Here, the Montague and Capulet families engage in a bitter and violent feud, mirroring their historical animosity but played out amidst contemporary urban landscapes and with modern weaponry. Despite the updated visual aesthetic, Luhrmann boldly retains Shakespeare's original Elizabethan dialogue, creating a unique juxtaposition of the old and the new.

The film stars Leonardo DiCaprio as Romeo Montague and Claire Danes as Juliet Capulet, whose families are sworn enemies. Their passionate love affair blossoms despite the deep-seated hatred between their houses, leading to secret vows and increasingly desperate measures. Luhrmann's energetic direction, combined with a dynamic soundtrack and striking visual style, brought Shakespeare to a new generation, earning both critical acclaim and commercial success. The film was celebrated for its innovative approach to a classic text, its passionate performances, and its ability to capture the timeless themes of love, fate, and the destructive nature of hatred in a visually compelling and accessible way. It remains a significant and influential adaptation of Shakespeare for a contemporary audience.

Title: Bloodshot (2020)
DESCRIPTION:
"Bloodshot," a 2020 action-packed superhero film directed by Dave Wilson, brings to the screen the Valiant Comics character of the same name. The story begins with U.S. Marine Ray Garrison (Vin Diesel) and his wife being brutally murdered. However, Ray's story doesn't end there. He is brought back to life by RST Corporation, a team of scientists who utilize cutting-edge nanotechnology to transform him into a superhuman killing machine known as Bloodshot.

Enhanced with microscopic nanites in his bloodstream, Bloodshot possesses incredible strength, agility, and rapid healing abilities. Initially, Ray has no memory of his past life, but as his memories begin to resurface, he is driven by a singular goal: revenge against the man he believes murdered him and his wife. He breaks free from the RST facility to pursue his vengeance, only to uncover a deeper conspiracy that makes him question everything he thought he knew. "Bloodshot" delivers high-octane action sequences and explores themes of memory manipulation and what it means to be human in an age of advanced technology. As the first film in a planned cinematic universe based on Valiant Comics, it introduces a powerful new kind of superhero with a mysterious past and formidable abilities.

Title: 47 Ronin (2013)
DESCRIPTION:
"47 Ronin," a 2013 fantasy action film directed by Carl Rinsch, is inspired by the historical tale of the Akō incident, a legendary story of honor and revenge in feudal Japan, infused with fantastical elements. The film stars Keanu Reeves as Kai, a half-Japanese, half-British outcast who is taken in by Lord Asano (Min Tanaka). When Lord Asano is betrayed and killed by the treacherous Lord Kira (Tadanobu Asano) with the aid of a powerful witch (Rinko Kikuchi), his loyal samurai are left masterless and branded as ronin.

Oishi (Hiroyuki Sanada), the former leader of Asano's samurai, rallies the forty-seven disgraced warriors, including the skilled but marginalized Kai, to embark on a perilous quest for vengeance against Kira and to restore honor to their fallen lord and their homeland. Their journey takes them through a world filled with mythical creatures, dark magic, and formidable adversaries, testing their courage, loyalty, and fighting prowess. "47 Ronin" blends traditional samurai action with fantastical visual elements, offering a stylized and epic tale of retribution and the unwavering commitment to honor in the face of seemingly insurmountable odds. While the film took liberties with the historical account by adding fantasy elements, it aimed to deliver a visually spectacular and emotionally resonant story of loyalty and sacrifice.

Title: Sunshine (2007)
DESCRIPTION:
"Sunshine," a visually stunning and thought-provoking 2007 science fiction thriller directed by Danny Boyle, paints a picture of Earth fifty years in the future, where the sun is dying, plunging the planet into a new ice age and threatening all life. Humanity's last hope lies with a team of eight astronauts aboard the spaceship Icarus II, sent on a perilous mission to reignite the sun with a massive stellar bomb.

Seven years prior, the first Icarus mission failed, adding immense pressure to this new endeavor. As the crew journeys closer to their life-or-death objective, they begin to face a series of increasingly strange and dangerous events, both internal and external, that threaten to derail their mission and the fate of mankind. "Sunshine" blends scientific concepts with psychological tension and breathtaking visuals, exploring themes of sacrifice, humanity's place in the universe, and the terrifying power of the cosmos. The film garnered praise for its atmospheric cinematography, its compelling performances (including Cillian Murphy, Chris Evans, and Michelle Yeoh), and its haunting score, creating a gripping and memorable cinematic experience that delves into the extremes of human endurance and the mysteries of existence.

Title: Warcraft (2016)
DESCRIPTION:
"Warcraft," a 2016 fantasy epic directed by Duncan Jones, brings to life the rich and expansive universe of the popular video game franchise. The film depicts the initial conflict between the human realm of Azeroth and the orcish Horde, who are forced to flee their dying world of Draenor through a magical portal to seek refuge and a new home.

As the portal opens, connecting these two vastly different civilizations, war becomes inevitable. On the human side, the noble King Llane Wrynn (Dominic Cooper) and the valiant knight Anduin Lothar (Travis Fimmel) lead the defense of Azeroth. On the orcish side, the honorable chieftain Durotan (Toby Kebbell) and the powerful warlock Gul'dan (Daniel Wu) grapple with the survival of their people, even if it means invading a new world. "Warcraft" portrays the conflict from both perspectives, highlighting the motivations and struggles of characters on each side of the impending war. The film utilizes extensive visual effects to bring the fantastical creatures and landscapes of Azeroth and Draenor to the big screen. While opinions on its adaptation of the beloved game lore were varied, "Warcraft" offers a large-scale fantasy adventure with epic battles and a story of two worlds colliding.

Title: Reign of Fire (2002)
DESCRIPTION:
"Reign of Fire," a 2002 post-apocalyptic action fantasy film directed by Rob Bowman, envisions a world where fire-breathing dragons have re-emerged after centuries of dormancy beneath the Earth's surface, pushing humanity to the brink of extinction. The story is set in a ravaged England, where Quinn Abercromby (Christian Bale) leads a community of survivors, constantly battling the winged beasts for their very existence. Quinn's personal history is deeply intertwined with the dragons, as his mother was killed by one when he was a child.

The arrival of Denton Van Zan (Matthew McConaughey), a charismatic and determined American volunteer, brings a new perspective and a more aggressive approach to fighting the dragons. Van Zan, who claims to know how to kill the seemingly immortal King Dragon – the source of all the other dragons – teams up with Quinn, despite their differing philosophies on survival. "Reign of Fire" delivers a thrilling and visually impressive spectacle of humans versus dragons, set against a desolate backdrop. While the premise is fantastical, the film explores themes of leadership, hope in the face of overwhelming odds, and the primal instinct to survive. It offers a unique take on the dragon mythos, portraying them as a dominant, destructive force that has reclaimed the planet.

Title: The Dark Tower (2017)
DESCRIPTION:
"The Dark Tower," a 2017 film adaptation of Stephen King's epic fantasy series, directed by Nikolaj Arcel, introduces audiences to a world where the fate of all realities hangs in the balance. The story centers on Roland Deschain (Idris Elba), the last Gunslinger, a noble warrior locked in a timeless battle against Walter O'Dim, also known as the Man in Black (Matthew McConaughey). Walter is determined to destroy the Dark Tower, a mystical structure that serves as the linchpin holding the vast multiverse together. Should the Tower fall, chaos and darkness will consume all worlds.

Intertwined with Roland's quest is the journey of Jake Chambers (Tom Taylor), a troubled young boy from New York who possesses psychic abilities and visions of the Dark Tower and the Man in Black. Drawn into Roland's world, Jake becomes an unlikely ally in the Gunslinger's mission to prevent Walter's destructive plans. "The Dark Tower" blends elements of Western, fantasy, and horror, offering a glimpse into a sprawling mythology filled with magic, monsters, and a desperate fight between good and evil. While the film aimed to capture the essence of King's extensive saga, it faced mixed reviews upon its release, with some praising its casting and concept while others felt it didn't fully capture the depth and scope of the source material. Nevertheless, it presents a universe ripe with potential and a classic struggle against overwhelming darkness.

Title: Smokin' Aces (2006)
DESCRIPTION:
"Smokin' Aces," a 2006 action-packed crime thriller written and directed by Joe Carnahan, throws audiences into a chaotic and violent world when Buddy \"Aces\" Israel (Jeremy Piven), a flamboyant Las Vegas magician with ties to the mafia, decides to turn state's evidence against his former associates. Once the word gets out that Aces is ready to talk, a massive $1 million bounty is placed on his head, attracting a colorful and deadly array of assassins, hitmen, and bounty hunters from all corners.

Set in a Lake Tahoe penthouse where Aces is under FBI protection, the film follows the converging paths of numerous eccentric and dangerous characters, each with their own unique skills and motivations for wanting to take him out. Among them are a pair of seductive contract killers (Alicia Keys and Taraji P. Henson), a psychopathic trio of brothers (Chris Pine, Ben Foster, and Kevin Durand), and a mysterious master of disguise (Tommy Flanagan). As the clock ticks down, the penthouse becomes a battleground of bullets, betrayals, and unexpected twists. \"Smokin' Aces\" is known for its hyperkinetic style, its dark humor, and its ensemble cast of memorable characters. While opinions on its over-the-top violence were divided, the film gained a following for its relentless pace and its unpredictable narrative.

Title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2 (2014)
DESCRIPTION:
"The Amazing Spider-Man 2," the 2014 sequel directed by Marc Webb, continues the story of Peter Parker (Andrew Garfield) as he navigates the complexities of being Spider-Man while also trying to maintain a normal life with his girlfriend, Gwen Stacy (Emma Stone), with high school graduation on the horizon. Peter grapples with the promise he made to Gwen's late father to stay away from her to protect her from his dangerous world, a promise he finds increasingly difficult to keep.

Peter's already complicated life takes a turn with the emergence of a powerful new villain, Electro (Jamie Foxx), a former Oscorp employee who gains electric superpowers after an accident. Adding to Peter's challenges is the return of his childhood friend, Harry Osborn (Dane DeHaan), who is dealing with a terminal illness and seeks Spider-Man's help. As Peter confronts these new threats, he also uncovers more about the mysterious circumstances surrounding his parents' past. "The Amazing Spider-Man 2" delivers action-packed superhero sequences alongside emotional moments exploring Peter's relationships and his internal struggles. While the film received mixed reviews, it was praised for the chemistry between Garfield and Stone and its visual effects, further expanding the cinematic world of this iteration of Spider-Man.

Title: Spider-Man: Far From Home (2019)
DESCRIPTION:
"Spider-Man: Far From Home," the 2019 sequel directed by Jon Watts, picks up after the monumental events of "Avengers: Endgame," as Peter Parker (Tom Holland) and his classmates embark on a summer field trip to Europe. Hoping for a chance to relax and take a break from his superhero duties, Peter's plans are quickly disrupted when Nick Fury (Samuel L. Jackson) unexpectedly recruits him for a new mission. Mysterious elemental creatures have begun attacking various cities across the continent, and Fury needs Spider-Man's help to stop them.

Adding to the complexity, Peter encounters Quentin Beck (Jake Gyllenhaal), a seemingly heroic figure from another dimension who claims to have come to Earth to fight these Elementals. As Peter grapples with the weight of responsibility left by Tony Stark and tries to navigate his feelings for his classmate MJ (Zendaya), he must also determine who he can truly trust. "Spider-Man: Far From Home" blends thrilling action sequences with humor and emotional depth, exploring Peter's journey as he steps into a larger role in a post-Iron Man world. The film was a major box office success and received positive reviews, praised for its engaging story, the performances of its cast, and its clever twists and turns that have significant implications for the future of the MCU's Spider-Man.

Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017)
DESCRIPTION:
"Spider-Man: Homecoming," the 2017 entry that officially brought Spider-Man into the Marvel Cinematic Universe, directed by Jon Watts, follows the journey of Peter Parker (Tom Holland) after his memorable appearance in "Captain America: Civil War." Eager to prove himself as more than just the friendly neighborhood Spider-Man, Peter struggles to balance his high school life in Queens, New York City, with his aspirations of becoming a full-fledged Avenger under the watchful eye of his mentor, Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.).

While trying to navigate homework, crushes, and teenage awkwardness, Peter encounters a formidable new threat in the form of Adrian Toomes, also known as the Vulture (Michael Keaton), a disgruntled construction worker who turns to selling weapons made from alien technology. As the Vulture's criminal activities escalate, Peter sees an opportunity to step up and demonstrate his heroic capabilities, often to the chagrin of Stark, who urges patience. "Spider-Man: Homecoming" offers a fresh and youthful take on the iconic superhero, blending thrilling action sequences with genuine coming-of-age elements and humor. The film was a critical and commercial success, praised for Tom Holland's charismatic portrayal of a relatable teenage Peter Parker and its seamless integration into the broader MCU, establishing a new and exciting chapter for the beloved web-slinger.

Title: X-Men: Days of Future Past (2014)
DESCRIPTION:
"X-Men: Days of Future Past," the critically acclaimed 2014 installment in the X-Men film franchise directed by Bryan Singer, unites the original and younger X-Men casts in a time-bending narrative with the fate of mutant and human-kind hanging in the balance. In a bleak and dystopian future, mutants are hunted to the brink of extinction by powerful, adaptable robots called Sentinels. The surviving X-Men, including Professor Charles Xavier (Patrick Stewart), Magneto (Ian McKellen), Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), and Storm (Halle Berry), make a desperate decision to send Wolverine's consciousness back in time to his younger self in 1973.

Wolverine's mission is to find and convince the younger Professor X (James McAvoy) and the younger Magneto (Michael Fassbender), who are fractured and at odds, to join forces and prevent a catastrophic event that triggers the creation of the Sentinels. This involves stopping Mystique (Jennifer Lawrence) from assassinating Bolivar Trask (Peter Dinklage), the creator of the deadly machines. "Days of Future Past" seamlessly blends action, suspense, and emotional depth, offering a compelling story that explores themes of prejudice, survival, and the consequences of past actions on the future. The film was a major critical and commercial success, praised for its ambitious scope, strong performances, and its successful integration of two generations of X-Men characters, effectively resetting the timeline for future installments in the series.

Title: Ghost in the Shell (2017)
DESCRIPTION:
"Ghost in the Shell," a 2017 live-action adaptation of the acclaimed Japanese manga series and 1995 anime film of the same name, directed by Rupert Sanders, unfolds in a visually stunning near future where cybernetic enhancements are commonplace. The story centers on Major Mira Killian (Scarlett Johansson), a unique being who is the first of her kind: a human brain transplanted into a powerful artificial body (a 'full-body prosthesis') after surviving a catastrophic accident. Enhanced with advanced cybernetic abilities, Major serves as a field commander in the elite Section 9, a special operations unit dedicated to combating cybercrime and terrorism.

Tasked with stopping a mysterious and dangerous cyber-terrorist known as Kuze (Michael Pitt), who is targeting Hanka Robotics, the corporation responsible for Major's creation, she begins to uncover secrets about her own past and the origins of her cybernetic body. As she delves deeper into the investigation, Major starts to question her identity and the nature of her humanity. "Ghost in the Shell" is praised for its striking visual fidelity to the source material and its exploration of themes related to identity, transhumanism, and the intersection of human consciousness and artificial intelligence. While the film sparked some controversy regarding its casting choices, it offers a visually rich and action-packed cyberpunk thriller that grapples with philosophical questions at its core.

Title: Capone (2020)
DESCRIPTION:
"Capone," a 2020 biographical crime drama written and directed by Josh Trank, offers a different perspective on the infamous gangster Al Capone, portrayed by Tom Hardy. Rather than focusing on his reign of terror during Prohibition-era Chicago, the film depicts Capone in his later years, at the age of 47, following nearly a decade of imprisonment for tax evasion. Suffering from neurosyphilis, Capone's once formidable mind is deteriorating due to dementia, causing his past to bleed into his present reality. He is haunted by fragmented memories of his violent and criminal life, blurring the lines between his former ruthless self and his current weakened state.

The film explores the psychological and physical decline of a man who once commanded immense power and fear. Confined to his lavish Florida estate, Capone is surrounded by family and watched closely by the FBI, who still suspect he may be hiding a fortune. "Capone" delves into the inner turmoil of a legendary figure grappling with the consequences of his actions and the ravages of his illness. Tom Hardy's intense performance anchors this character study, which offers a more intimate and less glorified look at the final chapter of one of America's most notorious criminals. While the film received mixed reviews, Hardy's portrayal of a fading icon garnered attention for its commitment to the character's physical and mental deterioration.

Title: Under the Skin (2013)
DESCRIPTION:
"Under the Skin," a visually arresting and unsettling 2013 science fiction horror film directed by Jonathan Glazer, features Scarlett Johansson in a mesmerizing and enigmatic performance. She portrays an alien entity that has taken on human form and navigates the desolate landscapes and urban fringes of Scotland. Driving a van, she seduces and lures unsuspecting men back to a mysterious, otherworldly location where they meet a bizarre and terrifying fate.

As this extraterrestrial being continues her predatory mission, subtle yet profound changes begin to occur within her human guise. She starts to experience glimpses of human emotion and curiosity, leading to a gradual questioning of her purpose and a potential shift in her behavior. "Under the Skin" is a film that prioritizes atmosphere and mood over conventional narrative, employing striking imagery, minimalist dialogue, and a haunting score by Mica Levi to create a deeply immersive and often unsettling experience. Upon its release, the film divided audiences but garnered significant critical acclaim for its originality, its daring visual style, and Johansson's captivating portrayal of an alien attempting to understand humanity. It remains a unique and thought-provoking entry in the science fiction and horror genres, exploring themes of identity, perception, and what it means to be human from an alien perspective.

Title: Apocalypse Now (1979)
DESCRIPTION:
"Apocalypse Now," Francis Ford Coppola's epic and visually stunning 1979 war film, is a cinematic journey into the heart of darkness during the Vietnam War. Based loosely on Joseph Conrad's novella "Heart of Darkness," the film follows U.S. Army Captain Benjamin L. Willard (Martin Sheen) on a perilous and surreal mission deep into the Cambodian jungle. His objective: to find and assassinate the renegade Colonel Walter E. Kurtz (Marlon Brando), a highly decorated officer who has seemingly gone insane and established himself as a god-like figure among a local Montagnard tribe.

As Willard travels upriver on a Navy patrol boat, accompanied by a diverse and increasingly disillusioned crew, he witnesses the brutal absurdity and psychological toll of the war firsthand. The film is renowned for its powerful imagery, its exploration of complex themes such as morality, madness, and the corrupting influence of power, and its immersive sound design. "Apocalypse Now" was a troubled production, plagued by delays and cost overruns, but upon its release, it was hailed as a masterpiece, winning the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival and receiving numerous Academy Award nominations. It remains a landmark film in cinematic history, celebrated for its ambition, its unflinching portrayal of the Vietnam War's impact, and its iconic performances.

Title: The Way of the Gun (2000)
DESCRIPTION:
"The Way of the Gun," a gritty and action-packed crime thriller released in 2000, marks the directorial debut of Christopher McQuarrie, the Academy Award-winning screenwriter of "The Usual Suspects." The film centers on two drifters and small-time criminals, Parker (Ryan Phillippe) and Longbaugh (Benicio del Toro), who impulsively decide to kidnap Robin Weisz (Juliette Lewis), a surrogate mother carrying the child of a wealthy and powerful businessman. Their seemingly straightforward plan quickly spirals into a brutal and dangerous confrontation when they realize the men they've crossed – the expectant father's ruthless security detail, led by the formidable Sarno (James Caan) and Ochs (Taye Diggs) – are far more dangerous and resourceful than they anticipated.

What follows is a relentless and violent battle for survival as Parker and Longbaugh find themselves outgunned and outmaneuvered, desperately trying to protect their hostage and escape the deadly web they've woven. "The Way of the Gun" is known for its stylish action sequences, its sharp and often profane dialogue (characteristic of McQuarrie's writing), and its morally ambiguous characters. While it received mixed reviews upon its initial release, the film has since garnered a cult following for its raw intensity and its commitment to old-school cinematic gunfights. It offers a stark and unforgiving look at the consequences of impulsive criminal behavior and the brutal realities of a world where violence is the ultimate language.

Title: Saw (2004)
DESCRIPTION:
"Saw," the groundbreaking 2004 horror film directed by James Wan, unleashed a new wave of terror upon audiences. The movie begins with two strangers, Dr. Lawrence Gordon (Cary Elwes) and Adam Stanheight (Leigh Whannell), waking up chained in a dilapidated and grimy bathroom. They soon discover they are the unwilling participants in a deadly game orchestrated by a sadistic serial killer known only as "Jigsaw." Each man is given specific instructions and a limited time to complete a gruesome task in order to survive, while a mysterious corpse lies between them.

As Lawrence and Adam desperately try to understand their predicament and find a way to escape, they must piece together cryptic clues and confront dark secrets from their past. "Saw" is a suspenseful and visceral thriller that relies on psychological tension and shocking twists, rather than excessive gore (though it certainly has its moments). The film's intricate plot, its claustrophobic setting, and its unforgettable ending catapulted it to cult status and launched a successful horror franchise. Made on a small budget, "Saw" became a massive box office hit and is credited with popularizing the "torture porn" subgenre of horror in the mid-2000s. It remains a significant and influential film in the modern horror landscape for its innovative premise and its ability to leave audiences on the edge of their seats.

Title: The Devil's Rejects (2005)
DESCRIPTION:
"The Devil's Rejects," a brutal and unflinching 2005 horror film written and directed by Rob Zombie, serves as a direct sequel to his 2003 movie "House of 1000 Corpses." The film follows the notorious Firefly family – Otis B. Driftwood (Bill Moseley), Baby Firefly (Sheri Moon Zombie), and Captain Spaulding (Sid Haig) – as they embark on a violent and chaotic road trip across the Texas countryside after a police raid on their isolated home.

Leaving a gruesome trail of bodies in their wake, the Fireflys encounter various unsuspecting victims and are relentlessly pursued by Sheriff John Wydell (William Forsythe), a lawman with his own dark methods and a personal vendetta against the family. "The Devil's Rejects" shifts the tone slightly from the more cartoonish horror of its predecessor, delving into a grittier and more nihilistic portrayal of violence and its consequences. While shocking and disturbing, the film garnered praise for its raw intensity, strong performances, and its homage to classic 1970s exploitation cinema. It solidified Rob Zombie's reputation as a distinctive voice in contemporary horror and has since become a controversial yet highly regarded entry in the genre for its uncompromising vision.

Title: Gamer (2009)
DESCRIPTION:
"Gamer," a 2009 action-thriller directed by Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor, plunges into a dystopian near future where human beings are the avatars in violent, mass-scale online multiplayer games. The film primarily focuses on two such games: the controversial real-life simulation Society, where players control actual people in their everyday lives, and the more extreme Slayers, a deathmatch arena where death row inmates fight for the chance of freedom under the remote control of wealthy gamers.

Kable (Gerard Butler), a wrongly convicted death row inmate and the star player of Slayers controlled by a teenage gamer named Simon (Logan Lerman), becomes a symbol of hope for those seeking to expose and dismantle the ethically dubious system. As Kable fights for his survival in the brutal arena, he also strives to regain his own identity and break free from the control of his puppeteer, all while navigating the dangerous conspiracies surrounding the games' creators and the powerful forces that seek to maintain the status quo. "Gamer" delivers a high-octane, visually aggressive experience that explores themes of free will, technological control, and the desensitizing effects of violent entertainment. While it received mixed reviews upon its release, the film has garnered attention for its provocative premise and its relentless action sequences.

Title: Evil Dead II (1987)
DESCRIPTION:
"Evil Dead II," the 1987 sequel directed by Sam Raimi, picks up the gory and comedic mayhem where its predecessor left off. Bruce Campbell returns as Ash Williams, who, along with his girlfriend Linda, revisits the infamous cabin in the woods. Their ill-fated trip leads to the resurgence of the demonic forces of the Evil Dead, unleashed once again by the Necronomicon Ex-Mortis, the Book of the Dead.
